content.question: The current as a function of time in Inductor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, with inductance <math alttext="L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, is given by the graph shown. Inductor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>is replaced with Inductor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, with inductance <math alttext="L sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="L sub 2 is greater than L sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>L</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, and the same current as a function of time is established in Inductor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="open E sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, the maximum <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> in Inductor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, to <math alttext="open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, the maximum <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> in Inductor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="open E sub 1 is greater than open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="open E sub 1 equals open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="open E sub 1 is less than open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

The maximum <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> cannot be compared without knowing the time at which the maximum <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> occurs for each inductor.

content.answer: <math alttext="open E sub 1 is less than open E sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>Ɛ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
